text:
The Eiffel Tower is located in Paris.
The Colosseum is located in Rome.
The Great Wall of China was built over many centuries.
The Taj Mahal is located in Agra, India.
The Statue of Liberty is located in New York Harbor.
The Sydney Opera House is located in Sydney.
The Golden Gate Bridge spans the Golden Gate strait.
The Pyramids of Giza are located near Cairo, Egypt.
The Parthenon is located in Athens, Greece.
The Burj Khalifa is located in Dubai.

The Museum of Modern Art in New York focuses on contemporary art from the late 19th century onward.
The Louvre Museum in Paris houses the painting known as the Mona Lisa.
The Tate Modern is a major contemporary art museum in London and occupies a former power station.
The Venice Biennale is an international art exhibition held every two years.
The Uffizi Gallery in Florence is known for Renaissance art collections.
The Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York spans multiple historical periods and

he Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York spans multiple historical periods and cultures.
The Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao is known for its titanium-clad building designed by Frank Gehry.
The British Museum in London holds extensive collections from ancient civilizations.
The Hermitage Museum in Saint Petersburg is among the largest museums in the world.
The Prado Museum in Madrid is noted for European masterworks from the 12th to the early 20th century.

The Sun is a G-type main-sequence star located at the center of the Solar System.
Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and has no natural moons.
Venus rotates in the opposite direction to most planets in the Solar System.
Earth is the only planet known to support liquid surface water.
Mars has the largest volcano in the Solar System, Olympus Mons.
Jupiter is the largest planet and has a prominent storm called the Great Red Spot.
Saturn is known for its extensive ring system made mostly of ic

Great Red Spot.
Saturn is known for its extensive ring system made mostly of ice particles.
Uranus has an axial tilt that makes it appear to roll along its orbit.
Neptune was discovered through mathematical prediction before it was observed.
The Milky Way is the galaxy that contains the Solar System.

Albert Einstein developed the theory of relativity.
Isaac Newton formulated the laws of motion.
Marie Curie conducted pioneering research on radioactivity.
Charles Darwin proposed the theory of evolution by natural selection.
Galileo Galilei supported heliocentrism.
Nikola Tesla worked on alternating current systems.
Ada Lovelace is associated with early computing concepts.
Louis Pasteur developed pasteurization and vaccines.
Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin.
Thomas Edison held many paten

vaccines.
Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin.
Thomas Edison held many patents for inventions.

Cells are the basic structural and functional units of living organisms.
DNA carries genetic information in most living organisms.
Photosynthesis converts carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen using sunlight.
Mitochondria are organelles often described as the powerhouses of the cell.
Proteins are made from amino acids linked by peptide bonds.
The human brain is part of the central nervous system.
The circulatory system transports blood and nutrients throughout the body.
Viruses requir

latory system transports blood and nutrients throughout the body.
Viruses require host cells to replicate.
Bacteria are single-celled microorganisms found in diverse environments.
Evolution by natural selection explains how populations change over time.

Water is a chemical compound with the formula H2O.
Carbon dioxide has the formula CO2.
Sodium chloride is common table salt.
The periodic table organizes elements by atomic number.
Hydrogen is the lightest element.
Oxygen is required for aerobic respiration in many organisms.
Gold has the chemical symbol Au.
Iron has the chemical symbol Fe.
Helium is a noble gas.
The pH scale measures acidity and basicity in aqueous solutions.

Apple is headquartered in Cupertino, California.
Microsoft was founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen.
Google was founded in 1998 by Larry Page and Sergey Brin.
Amazon is headquartered in Seattle, Washington.
Tesla is an electric vehicle company founded by Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning.

A CPU performs arithmetic and logical operations.
RAM is volatile memory used for temporary data storage.
A hard drive provides persistent storage.
An operating system manages hardware and software resources.
The TCP/IP protocol suite enables communication on the Internet.
HTTP is a protocol used for transferring web pages.
A database index improves query performance.
Encryption protects data by transforming it into an unreadable form without a key.
A compiler translates source code into machine

an unreadable form without a key.
A compiler translates source code into machine code.
Version control systems track changes to files over time.

Earth has one natural satellite, the Moon.
The Earth's atmosphere is composed primarily of nitrogen and oxygen.
The Earth orbits the Sun once every year.
A day on Earth is about 24 hours long.
Volcanoes are openings in the Earth's crust where magma can reach the surface.
Earthquakes are caused by sudden movements along faults.
The water cycle includes evaporation, condensation, and precipitation.
Oceans cover most of the Earth's surface.
The highest layer of Earth's atmosphere is the exosphere.

the Earth's surface.
The highest layer of Earth's atmosphere is the exosphere.
The lowest layer of Earth's atmosphere is the troposphere.

Inflation refers to a sustained increase in the general price level of goods and services.
A central bank typically sets monetary policy to influence interest rates and inflation.
Gross domestic product (GDP) measures the total value of goods and services produced within a country.
Unemployment rates track the share of the labor force that is without work but seeking employment.
Supply and demand are basic economic forces that influence prices.
A recession is commonly defined as a significant de

orces that influence prices.
A recession is commonly defined as a significant decline in economic activity over multiple months.
Fiscal policy involves government spending and taxation decisions.
Trade deficits occur when a country imports more goods and services than it exports.
Exchange rates determine the value of one currency relative to another.
Productivity measures output per unit of input, such as labor hours.

A market economy allocates resources through supply and demand.
A command economy allocates resources through centralized planning.
Inflation reduces the purchasing power of money over time.
Deflation is a sustained decrease in the general price level.
Interest rates affect borrowing and saving decisions.
A tariff is a tax on imported goods.
A subsidy is financial assistance provided by a government.
A budget deficit occurs when spending exceeds revenue.
The stock market allows trading of compan

occurs when spending exceeds revenue.
The stock market allows trading of company shares.
A recession involves a broad decline in economic activity.

Primary education provides foundational literacy and numeracy skills.
Secondary education builds on core subjects and may include specialized coursework.
Higher education includes universities and colleges that grant academic degrees.
Renewable energy sources include solar, wind, hydro, and geothermal power.
Fossil fuels such as coal, oil, and natural gas are non-renewable energy sources.
Solar panels convert sunlight into electricity using photovoltaic cells.
Wind turbines generate electricity

t into electricity using photovoltaic cells.
Wind turbines generate electricity by converting kinetic wind energy into mechanical power.
Hydroelectric power uses flowing water to generate electricity.
Energy efficiency measures aim to reduce energy use while maintaining the same output.
Battery storage helps balance electricity supply and demand on power grids.

Climate refers to long-term patterns of weather.
Weather describes short-term atmospheric conditions.
Greenhouse gases include carbon dioxide and methane.
Deforestation can reduce biodiversity.
Recycling reduces waste sent to landfills.
Renewable energy can reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
Air pollution can harm human health.
Water pollution can damage ecosystems.
Biodiversity refers to the variety of life in an ecosystem.
Conservation efforts aim to protect natural resources.

Christopher Columbus led voyages across the Atlantic in the late 15th century.
Ferdinand Magellan's expedition achieved the first circumnavigation of the Earth, completed after his death.
James Cook mapped many areas of the Pacific Ocean during the 18th century.
Marco Polo traveled along parts of the Silk Road and documented his journeys.
Roald Amundsen was the first person to reach the South Pole.
Ernest Shackleton led expeditions to Antarctica in the early 20th century.
Zheng He commanded larg

led expeditions to Antarctica in the early 20th century.
Zheng He commanded large naval expeditions for the Ming dynasty.
Lewis and Clark led an expedition to explore the Louisiana Purchase territory.
Ibn Battuta traveled extensively across Africa, Asia, and Europe.
Amerigo Vespucci explored South America and wrote accounts of his voyages.

A stock represents ownership in a company.
A bond is a fixed-income instrument that represents a loan from an investor to a borrower.
Diversification can reduce risk in an investment portfolio.
Interest rates influence borrowing costs and savings returns.
Compound interest calculates interest on both principal and previously accrued interest.
A budget outlines expected income and expenses over a period of time.
Whole grains include the bran, germ, and endosperm of the grain.
Protein is a macronu

grains include the bran, germ, and endosperm of the grain.
Protein is a macronutrient essential for tissue repair and growth.
Dietary fiber supports digestive health.
Vitamins and minerals are micronutrients required in small amounts.

Rice is a staple food in many countries.
Wheat is commonly used to make bread.
Olive oil is a common ingredient in Mediterranean cuisine.
Sushi is a Japanese dish made with vinegared rice.
Pasta is a traditional Italian food.
Chocolate is made from cacao beans.
Coffee is brewed from roasted coffee beans.
Tea is made by infusing leaves of the Camellia sinensis plant.
Cheese is a dairy product made from milk.
Fermentation is used to make foods like yogurt and kimchi.

Paris is the capital of France.
Berlin is the capital of Germany.
The Nile is the longest river in Africa.

The Amazon River is the largest river by discharge volume.
The Andes are the longest continental mountain range.
Mount Everest is the highest mountain above sea level.
The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world.
The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of Australia.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth.
The Mediterranean Sea connects to the Atlantic Ocean through the Strait of Gibraltar.
The Himalayas form a natural barrier between the Indian subcontinent and the Tibetan

Himalayas form a natural barrier between the Indian subcontinent and the Tibetan Plateau.
Iceland is a volcanic island located in the North Atlantic Ocean.
The Danube River flows through multiple European countries before reaching the Black Sea.

A democracy is a system of government in which citizens can vote for representatives.
A constitution defines the structure and powers of a government.
A federal system divides power between a central authority and regional units.
A parliamentary system typically has a prime minister as head of government.
A republic is a form of government without a monarch.
A bicameral legislature has two chambers or houses.
An executive branch enforces laws passed by the legislature.
The judicial branch interp

utive branch enforces laws passed by the legislature.
The judicial branch interprets laws and adjudicates disputes.
Sovereignty refers to supreme authority within a territory.
The rule of law means that laws apply equally to all individuals.

The heart is a muscular organ that pumps blood through the body.
Vaccines stimulate the immune system to protect against disease.
Antibiotics treat bacterial infections, not viral infections.
Blood pressure is measured in millimeters of mercury (mmHg).

The Apollo 11 mission landed humans on the Moon in 1969.
The Declaration of Independence was adopted in 1776.
World War II ended in 1945.

Bridges connect landmasses and allow transportation across obstacles like rivers.
Highways are major roads designed for long-distance travel.
Railways transport passengers and freight using trains on tracks.
Ports facilitate the movement of goods and passengers by sea.
Airports serve as hubs for air travel and cargo transport.
Water treatment plants remove contaminants to provide safe drinking water.
Power grids distribute electricity from generators to consumers.
Telecommunications networks tra

ribute electricity from generators to consumers.
Telecommunications networks transmit voice and data over long distances.
Public transit systems include buses, subways, and commuter rail services.
Urban planning guides land use and development in cities.

English is a West Germanic language that developed in medieval England.
Spanish is a Romance language spoken widely in Spain and Latin America.
French is a Romance language with global diplomatic and cultural influence.
Mandarin Chinese is the most widely spoken native language in the world.
Arabic includes many dialects and is written in an abjad script.
Hindi is one of the official languages of India.
Russian uses the Cyrillic alphabet.
Japanese uses a combination of kanji and syllabaries.
Swa

the Cyrillic alphabet.
Japanese uses a combination of kanji and syllabaries.
Swahili is a Bantu language spoken in East Africa.
German is a West Germanic language spoken in Central Europe.

A contract is a legally enforceable agreement between parties.
Tort law addresses civil wrongs and damages between individuals.
Criminal law defines offenses against the state and prescribes punishments.
A patent grants exclusive rights to an invention for a limited time.
A trademark protects symbols or words used to identify goods or services.
Vaccines help prevent infectious diseases by training the immune system.
Antibiotics target bacteria rather than viruses.
The liver plays a key role in m

Antibiotics target bacteria rather than viruses.
The liver plays a key role in metabolism and detoxification.
The kidneys filter waste from the blood.
A clinical trial tests the safety and efficacy of medical treatments.

William Shakespeare wrote plays such as Hamlet and Macbeth.
Jane Austen authored novels including Pride and Prejudice.
George Orwell wrote the novels 1984 and Animal Farm.
The novel Moby-Dick was written by Herman Melville.
The Iliad is an ancient epic poem attributed to Homer.
Newspapers report news and provide commentary on current events.
Television broadcasts audiovisual programming to a mass audience.
Radio transmits audio content using electromagnetic waves.
Documentary films aim to presen

smits audio content using electromagnetic waves.
Documentary films aim to present factual information about real events.
The printing press revolutionized the distribution of books and information.

A prime number has exactly two positive divisors.
Zero is neither positive nor negative.
The sum of angles in a triangle is 180 degrees in Euclidean geometry.
Pi is approximately 3.14159.
A right triangle has one 90-degree angle.
The Pythagorean theorem relates the sides of a right triangle.
An integer is a whole number that can be negative, zero, or positive.
A fraction represents a part of a whole.
A function maps inputs to outputs.
A set is a collection of distinct elements.

Canada's capital city is Ottawa.
Australia's capital city is Canberra.
Japan's capital city is Tokyo.
India's capital city is New Delhi.
Brazil's capital city is Brasilia.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
The United States capital city is Washington, D.C.
Mexico's capital city is Mexico City.
China's capital city is Beijing.
Italy's capital city is Rome.

Classical music is typically composed for orchestras and ensembles.
Jazz originated in the early 20th century and features improvisation.
The piano is a keyboard instrument with strings struck by hammers.
The guitar is a stringed instrument commonly used in many genres.
A symphony is a large-scale orchestral composition.
The Atlantic Ocean separates the Americas from Europe and Africa.
The Indian Ocean lies between Africa, Asia, and Australia.
The Southern Ocean surrounds Antarctica.
The Arctic

frica, Asia, and Australia.
The Southern Ocean surrounds Antarctica.
The Arctic Ocean is the smallest and shallowest ocean.
Tides are influenced by the gravitational pull of the Moon and the Sun.

The United Nations was founded in 1945.
The World Health Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations.
NASA is the United States government agency responsible for the civilian space program.
The European Union is a political and economic union of member states in Europe.
The Red Cross is an international humanitarian organization.

Ada Lovelace is often credited as an early pioneer of computing.
Alan Turing proposed the Turing Test in 1950.
Marie Curie won Nobel Prizes in both Physics and Chemistry.
Katherine Johnson worked at NASA and contributed to orbital mechanics.
Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web.

Nelson Mandela was a leader in the anti-apartheid movement in South Africa.
Mother Teresa was known for her humanitarian work in India.
Martin Luther King Jr. was a prominent leader in the American civil rights movement.
Amelia Earhart was an aviation pioneer and the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic.
Frida Kahlo was a Mexican painter known for self-portraits.
Nikola Tesla contributed to the development of alternating current electricity.
Isaac Newton formulated the laws of motion and

alternating current electricity.
Isaac Newton formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation.
Albert Einstein developed the theory of relativity.
Galileo Galilei made influential observations with a telescope.
Leonardo da Vinci was a Renaissance artist and inventor.

Newton's first law describes inertia.
Newton's second law relates force, mass, and acceleration.
The speed of light in vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
Gravity is a force of attraction between masses.
Electric current is the flow of electric charge.
Voltage is the electric potential difference between two points.
Ohm's law states that voltage equals current times resistance.
Energy can be measured in joules.
Power is measured in watts.
Sound is a mechanical wave that requir

ed in joules.
Power is measured in watts.
Sound is a mechanical wave that requires a medium.

Handwashing helps prevent the spread of infectious diseases.
Clean drinking water reduces the risk of waterborne illnesses.
Vaccination programs help prevent outbreaks.
Antibiotic resistance occurs when bacteria evolve to survive antibiotic treatment.
A balanced diet includes a variety of food groups.
Regular physical activity supports cardiovascular health.
Smoking increases the risk of lung cancer.
Excessive sugar intake can contribute to health problems.
Sleep is important for physical and me

intake can contribute to health problems.
Sleep is important for physical and mental health.
Public health focuses on improving health outcomes for communities.

Apollo 11 was the first mission to land humans on the Moon.
Voyager 1 was launched in 1977.
The Hubble Space Telescope was launched in 1990.
The International Space Station orbits Earth.
Mars rovers have been used to explore the surface of Mars.
The James Webb Space Telescope was launched in 2021.
Sputnik 1 was the first artificial satellite.
Yuri Gagarin was the first human in space.
The Space Shuttle was a reusable spacecraft operated by NASA.
Cassini studied Saturn and its moons.

Light is an electromagnetic wave.
The electromagnetic spectrum includes radio waves, visible light, and gamma rays.
A black hole has gravity so strong that light cannot escape.
The Big Bang theory describes the expansion of the universe from a hot dense state.
A light-year is a unit of distance.
Stars produce energy through nuclear fusion.
The Sun is a main-sequence star.
Planets orbit stars.
Comets are icy bodies that orbit the Sun.
Asteroids are rocky bodies mostly found in the asteroid belt.

The Olympic Games are held every four years.
Basketball is played with five players on the court per team.
The FIFA World Cup is held every four years.
Wimbledon is a Grand Slam tennis tournament held in London.

Soccer is played by two teams of eleven players.
The Super Bowl is the championship game of the National Football League.
The NBA is a professional basketball league in North America.
The Tour de France is an annual multi-stage bicycle race.
The Olympics include both summer and winter games.
Cricket is played with a bat and ball between two teams.
Baseball is a bat-and-ball sport popular in the United States.
Tennis is played as singles or doubles matches.
The Masters is a major championship tou

is played as singles or doubles matches.
The Masters is a major championship tournament in golf.
Formula One is a top-level international auto racing series.

Apple introduced the M1 chip in 2020.
Python is a programming language created by Guido van Rossum.
The Linux kernel was first released in 1991.

The transistor was invented in 1947 at Bell Labs.
The first electronic digital computers were developed in the 1940s.
The ARPANET was an early packet-switching network and a precursor to the Internet.
The World Wide Web was proposed by Tim Berners-Lee in 1989.
The iPhone was introduced by Apple in 2007.
The Linux operating system kernel was created by Linus Torvalds.
Open-source software allows users to view and modify source code.
Machine learning is a field of artificial intelligence focused o

fy source code.
Machine learning is a field of artificial intelligence focused on data-driven models.
Databases store structured information for retrieval and analysis.
Cloud computing provides on-demand access to shared computing resources.

IBM was founded in 1911.
Intel was founded in 1968.
Samsung was founded in 1938.
Sony was founded in 1946.
Meta Platforms was formerly known as Facebook.
Netflix is a streaming media company.
Adobe develops creative software products.
Salesforce provides cloud-based CRM software.
Oracle is known for database software.
NVIDIA designs graphics processing units.

Public transit systems reduce traffic congestion in urban areas.
Subways are rapid transit systems that operate underground.
Buses provide flexible routes in cities and rural areas.
Cycling infrastructure includes bike lanes and shared paths.
High-speed rail connects cities with fast passenger trains.
Urban density affects housing demand and transportation needs.
Zoning laws regulate land use and building types.
Mixed-use development combines residential and commercial spaces.
Pedestrian zones r

d-use development combines residential and commercial spaces.
Pedestrian zones restrict vehicle access to improve walkability.
Green spaces in cities provide recreation and environmental benefits.

Airplanes provide rapid long-distance travel.
Ships transport goods across oceans.
Trains run on rails and can carry passengers or freight.
Cars are commonly used for personal transportation.
Bicycles provide human-powered transportation.
Subways are urban rail systems that operate underground.
Traffic signals regulate vehicle and pedestrian movement.
Airports facilitate air travel.
Seaports support maritime trade.
Public transit includes buses, trains, and subways.

The Roman Empire was centered around the Mediterranean Sea.
The Renaissance was a cultural movement that began in Italy.
The Industrial Revolution started in Great Britain.
The printing press was developed by Johannes Gutenberg in the 15th century.
The Cold War was a period of geopolitical tension between the United States and the Soviet Union.
The Berlin Wall fell in 1989.
The United States declared independence in 1776.
The French Revolution began in 1789.
The Great Depression began in 1929.

1776.
The French Revolution began in 1789.
The Great Depression began in 1929.
World War I ended in 1918.
